views.markdown:
Compatible with iOS 11, 12 and 13

CCSupport adds the ability for other developers to add their own modules to the Control Center.
It does so in a safe way to ensure that the Control Center does not get messed up when the tweak is not loaded.

It also serves as a standalone tweak, because it unlocks the otherwise fixed modules to be moved in settings.
This includes the connectivity module, the media controls module, the brightness and volume slider modules and the AirPlay module.
Icons and names for these modules have been recreated, to ensure a stock look.

There also is a feature to reset the module layout for both configurations (tweak loaded, tweak not loaded).
The button to do that can be found at the bottom of the Control Center settings page.

Open source

- Fixes volume module icon and localization being broken on iOS 13 * Compiled for arm64e to support A12 - Updated arabic localization, thanks to iA7myd


- iOS 12 Support (Developed through RootlessJB)
- Added an option for developers to add preference pages directly to their modules (See documentation on GitHub)
* Added Arabic localization, thanks to txmamash
* Added Japanese localization, thanks to sohsato
* Added Italian localization, thanks to iSalvox
* Added Malay localization, thanks to Antman Avengers
* Added Dutch localization, thanks to Bassievalk
* Added French localization, thanks to Lionel B.
* Added Chinese (Traditional + Simplified) localizations, thanks to Joe Ye
- Added spanish localization, thanks to Simalary (Chris)

(If you want to help localizing this tweak in your language, make sure to contact me via email!)


* Added two ways for developers to specify custom sizes for their modules, documentation is available on GitHub

* Added notice about CCCleaner to the safety warning that appears when modified system files are detected

* Other minor improvements


* Now also unlocks the mute module on iPad

* Added a safety check that prevents the tweak from loading if fixed modules have been unlocked through system file edits done by the user (this would cause a safe mode crash anyways)
